author: bridge-bot
content:
<seunlanlege> Hello everyone, I'm currently working on an on-chain ethereum light client.

I have a question about `beacon_state.block_roots`, the specification seems to allude that this structure is a map of `slot_number` to `block_root`. Is that the correct assumption?

author: bridge-bot
content: <etan_status> yes, but it only goes back 8192 blocks. there is another field for history

author: bridge-bot
content: <seunlanlege> The other field is the historical block roots list

author: bridge-bot
content: <seunlanlege> Which itself is a list of the root hash of every block_roots

author: bridge-bot
content: <seunlanlege> Has any one perchance seen an implementation of the ssz Merkle multi-proof in the wild?

author: bridge-bot
content: <etan_status> > <etan_status>  it also includes state_root list in the historical roots. (re @seunlanlege: Which itself is a list of the root hash of every block_roots)

author: bridge-bot
content: <seunlanlege> > <seunlanlege>  Must've missed this, how ser.   (re @etan_status: it also includes state_root list in the historical roots.)
